SUMMARY:
As documented in this submittal, the RMP for the facility has been completed in accordance with all 40 CFR 68 requirements and the facility has certified compliance.  Holcim takes pride in and is committed to conducting business in strict conformity with all applicable laws in a safe and responsible manner.  The very highest priority is placed on the health and safety of Holcim's associates and the community in which we conduct business.

evention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:
The facility has implemented a Program Level 3 Program for pentane, as required by the RMP rule, in accordance with the US EPA guidance.  These prevention program provisions are specifically intended to minimize the probability and/or consequence of any accidental pentane release from the facility and include such measures as process hazards analysis, operating procedures, training, contractors, pre-start-up safety, mechanical integrity, hot work permit, management of change, incident investigation, emergency planning and response, and compliance audits.  The facility prevention program is an ongoing system based on periodic training, incident investigations, audits, procedure revisions, and RMP updates as required to reflect facility change and RMP requirements.

Five-Year Accident History:
The facility has had no RMP reportable accidents or releases of pentane.

Emergency Response Program:
The facility's Emergency Action Plan is intended to produce the maximum effective response in the least amount of time.  The facility has coordinated response with the local fire station and the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) to ensure that they will respond to any accidental release from the pentane system.  The facility has also established a notification mechanism to ensure the fire station will be properly notified when any response is needed for a pentane release. Based on this coordination with the local emergency responders, the facility is not required to implement any additional RMP emergency response program requirements.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
The facility is committed to ensuring its operations are safe and in accordance with all RMP requirements and has established a senior manager responsible for RMP development, implementation, and compliance.  This manager is committed to maintain the safety of the RMP covered pentane system through active adherence to the appropriate procedures and

Holcim is dedicated to protecting employees, the community, and the environment from highly hazardous incidents through safely operating our facility.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
The facility's overall approach and commitment to chemical safety is demonstrated by 1) the management, training, procedure, and maintenance systems in place at the facility, and 2) the hazard assessment, prevention program and emergency response provisions implemented specifically for pentane in response to the RMP requirement.  The management structure and oversight to ensure safety is documented in the facility's RMP and includes compliance with applicable regulations, codes and standards (OSHA PSM Standard and US EPA 40 CFR 68).

Source and Federal Regulated Substances Description:
The facility in Salt Lake City, Utah, uses a chemical blend of iso-pentane and acetone as the blowing agent to produce foam panels to be used as building insulation.  The blend consists of varying amounts of iso-pentane and acetone and is reported as a flammable mixture. The facility includes raw material unloading and storage, material blending operations, panel production and cutting, product storage, and loading operations.  The pentane blend will arrive by truck or rail and will be stored in a 50,000-gallon horizontal tank. 

The facility also has a small metal line which takes rolls of sheet metal, straightens them, and cuts the sheets to length.

The warehouse handles, stores and distributes various materials for the manufacture of building products, particularly insulation. The warehouse includes the receipt, handling, and storage of various products in small aerosol canisters containing greater than 1 wt. % of pentane as the blowing agent. The quantity of the covered products stored in the warehouse can fluctuate based on the season, therefore a conservative approach was taken in determining the maximum intended inventory for pentane.
